# Getting started with data

```{r}
#| results: "asis"

source("_common.R")
status("polishing")
```

In the first part of this book you learnt some foundational concepts about working with computers and now you are ready to take your first steps into analysing data with R. The first chapter is about data in general - the different types of data (discrete and continuous and how we summarise them. The second chapter introduces you to R and RStudio for the first time starting with the layout and appearance before you begin coding. The third chapter describes some useful patterns and tools to use for organising your work in RStudio which will make your life easier. Finally, we will go through a complete workflow
